oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A three-scale model of spatio-temporal bursting
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Franci, Alessio
Sepulchre, Rodolphe
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Dynamical Systems
Mathematics - Analysis of PDEs
Nonlinear Sciences - Pattern Formation and Solitons
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We study spatio-temporal bursting in a three-scale reaction diffusion equation organized by the winged cusp singularity. For large time-scale separation the model exhibits traveling bursts, whereas for large space-scale separation the model exhibits standing bursts. Both behaviors exhibit a common singular skeleton, whose geometry is fully determined by persistent bifurcation diagrams of the winged cusp. The modulation of spatio-temporal bursting in such a model naturally translates into paths in the universal unfolding of the winged-cusp.
